column4: Hi there folks.  Yet another newbie.  Anyone feeling helpful?  I've got a problem reading from one CD drive, and the writer will read fine but not write!  I've attempted to sort out my fstab, but still no better.  Have fstab up and disk manager up if that helps.  Cheers.  WhoDaBear (UK)
paste your fstab file into  http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/
and paste the link back here
- good job you said that!  Here: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/16774
by the look of thing you have two cd drivers ?  put a cd into one of drives and from a termal use the comman " mount/media/cdrom0 "  or " mount/media/cdrom1  "
sorry its " mount /media/cdrom0 "  or " mount /media/cdrom1  "

Thanks again.  Two drives.  One reader one writer.  Both internal.  Writer will read disks fine, but not write.  Reader will show me directory contents etc. but not let me copy to desktop.  Says I don't have permission.  Will try mounting now.  WDB.
Seems to mount fine auto when I stick the discs in.  Discs there on desktop.  Still want me to try mounting at the terminal?  Sorry - real Newbie!  Cheers.  WDB
no thats ok but what the app you are using for burning ?
- Just trying to drag files there.  That not good plan?  Assumed not working as other drive *definitely* not right!
so what the program that you are using for burn a cd or dvd ?
- sorry - give me a sec.
what do the command groups   out put and paste back here
- sorry - didn't understand that!
from a terminal use the command : groups    to see if you are in the cdrom group. i think you are all ready in that group, just checking
- creatures adm dialout cdrom floppy audio dip video plugdev lpadmin scanner admin  Thanks.  WDB
from the command line configure cdrecord so user can use it, no just root use.  comman " sudo dpkg-reconfigure cdrecord  "  and answer yes to the question it gives
(previous mis-spell).  Am trying to burn again now.  wdb.
can you see the problem from the paste >   Error: Cannot gain SYS_RAWIO capability.Is cdrecord installed SUID root? Operation not permitted   > thats why sudo dpkg-reconfigure cdrecord
- thanks for help so far.  Gonna give up and re-heat last night's curry.  Try again tomorrow I guess.  Thanks.  wdb.
np and all the best
